summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). Her name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. The consistent appearance of her name in these payroll documents indicates her employment with the committee during the specified period.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, a body tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during a specific period.
